basic.description: The seminar considers capitalism as the result of economic, social, political, and cultural change within interconnected regions of the world during the past millennium. Readings introduce scholarly critiques of Eurocentrism along with Marxist and post-structuralist critiques of capitalism and analyze increasing inequality between peoples and within societies over time.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Capitalism: A History

extra.enrollment_requirement: PREREQUISITE    A Grade of C+ in 6.0 units from HIST 300-329 and registration in a HIST Major or Medial Plan.
